description: Stores the system-generated unique identifier for the warehouse record; serves as the table’s primary key.
Stores the business identifier for the warehouse/location, typically a short alphanumeric code used on transactions and screens.
Provides the human-readable warehouse name or description.
Stores the primary street address for the warehouse.
Stores an additional address line (suite, building, etc.).
Stores a third address line if needed.
Stores the city for the warehouse’s physical address.
Holds the state/province code for the address; likely references a lookup table; confirm with SME.
Holds the postal or ZIP code for the warehouse address.
Holds the country code for the address; likely references a country lookup; confirm with SME.
Stores the county or administrative region for the address (optional).
Stores the primary contact phone for the warehouse.
Stores the fax number for the warehouse (if used).
Stores an alternate contact phone number (e.g., after-hours or direct line).
Describes the purpose or label of the alternate phone (e.g., after-hours, dispatch).
Free-text notes about the warehouse or location.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this record.
Flag indicating this location is combined with others for inventory or reporting; likely boolean (0/1); confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent user-driven modification (legacy audit field; may duplicate other timestamps); confirm with SME.
User ID of the person or process that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User ID of the person or process that last changed the record.
Timestamp when a user last modified the record.
